post.body: Also -- glad to see you'll come out with the cronies & me on wednesday
You are too modest. With those fearsome tatoos of yours, I'd be sure to bring a gun to *our* knife-fight.
With the all-publicity-is-good-publicity mantra in mind, I salute you for responding to the abstract. :)
The more the Yankees spend, the worse they do in the standings. This is going to be like the Yankees pre-Torre. Crappy.
I got 70% off on some stuff at Tahari last night...
@alexsotirov @viega Yeah, good article. All it takes is one corrupt CA who will issue an intermediate cert for the domain you want.
Re: thread death: 50 posts on 1 subject is enough. Sometimes they die a natural death, like Sinatra. No need for Scarface.
Very. I'm not above awful puns, and the later it gets the worse they are. :)
Cory, if you're presenting on Naughty SOAP attachments, you'd better make sure the deliverable is well-scrubbed. <ducks>
My first research report at Forrester went live today: http://tinyurl.com/8zcn2h. Mildly obnoxious, as usual. :)
Howdy folks! It's a new year out there! Time to make the doughnuts.
Just counted the 102 proposals the RSA Hosts track got this year. 19 were about virtualization. Crazy!
Pounding out a "Predictions for 2009" doc. Not the usual stuff. :) Here's a word I think we'll hear more about next year: entitlements.
No Ken Olsens chest-beating about superior tech. But no sales jocks crowing about how great sales are. You usually get one OR the other...
Just finished the Worst Briefing Ever. I take that back. It wasn't nearly as bad as Workshare ~3 years ago.
Just caught up on all of Viega's recent posts at O'Reilly. Good sensible stuff as usual.
